Title: 13.5 The JSON Data Type
Description: MySQL provides a JSON data type for storing JSON documents that conform to the RFC 7159 standard.
JSON values are stored in an optimized binary format internally, improving read efficiency and reducing storage space.
JSON columns are validated for correct syntax, and invalid JSON input results in an error instead of being stored as raw text.
The -> and ->> operators can be used to extract data from JSON documents, returning JSON values and text values respectively.
Built-in JSON functions such as JSON_EXTRACT, JSON_SET, JSON_ARRAY, and JSON_OBJECT enable querying, modifying, and constructing JSON structures.
JSON columns support virtual generated columns that can be indexed to improve query performance on JSON fields.
The storage size of JSON documents is limited by MySQL maximum row size and internal binary structure rules.
JSON values preserve their original data types and are not automatically converted to string format.
